intro: Chascotheca, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and compound leaves. Chascotheca species are often found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, some species are threatened by overharvesting.
